communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: NBTF compliance checks list
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of licensed establishments which have been the subject of compliance checks by the Nuisance Bar Task Force in 2024 and through May 4, 2025. This may take the form of a list, table, database, or other documentation. Please share the list in the format in which it is stored internally, which may contain other metadata such as dates. The bulletin of May 4, 2025 (https://content.govdelivery.com/accounts/PAPITT/bulletins/3dee809) contained a partial list of businesses and addresses in an acceptable format.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Josh Chamberlain

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Glenn R. Miles FBI Files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request any FBI records pertaining to Glenn R. Miles, who was killed in the line of duty as a Customs Agent for the U.S. Treasury Department in Arizona on February 21, 1986. This request includes, but is not limited to any FBI lab analysis of Agent Miles' handheld audio recorder, or references to its contents, as well as any 302s or field reports regarding Agent Miles' potential interactions with the alleged drug traffickers who were reportedly involved in his murder. Finally, this request includes any records sent or received by FBI to William Laverty, U.S. Customs Attache at the U.S. Embassy in Mexico City regarding the July 1986 arrest of five Mexican nationals in Hermosillo, Sonora, Mexico who were alleged to have been involved with the slaying.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting records about the department's recruiting campaign, Unrivaled. VGCA (Very Good Creative Agency, LLC)

All documents, data collected pre- and post-campaign launch, PowerPoint or equivalent slides, assets including videos created in draft or final form, design mockups, and final designs. 

All in digital or physical format. Records should cover each part of the project and its deliverables, including findings, brand audits, SWOT analysis, other analysis findings in KPIs from the below categories

- Research and Discovery: market and consumer research, competitive analysis, strategic recommendations
- Strategy and Positioning: brand strategy development, market segmentation and targeting, positioning strategy, campaign planning and integrated strategies
- Concept and Create: creative concept development, message creation and copywriting, visual design and art direction
- Produce and activate: campaign production management, creative asset production, media production and placement, quality control and compliance, performance tracking and reporting
- Assess and optimize: data collection and analysis, audience targeting and personalization, campaign optimization, social media ad optimization, retargeting and remarking strategies

Invoices, contracts, payments, and agreements made by the ad agency or the department with vendors, influencers, trademark, and licensing of the LAPD name, anyone, and any company working externally to the department, purchases for ads, digital, and physical

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Gerald Edward Connolly (March 30, 1950 – May 21, 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into Congressman Gerald Edward Connolly (March 30, 1950 – May 21, 2025). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his Fox News obituary at the following link: https://www.foxnews.com/politics/virginia-democratic-rep-gerry-connolly-dead-75

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: N.C. Actice Law Enforcement Officers Certification History
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

an electronic copy of the certification history for all currently active law enforcement officers in North Carolina. Specifically, I am seeking a complete spreadsheet containing, for each such officer’s certification record, the following fields:

Name
Academy ID number (as used in the ACADIS database)
Employing agency
Certification issue date
Certification status (active, inactive, revoked, etc.)
Separation date (if the certification status is now inactive)
Reason for separation (if the certification status is now inactive)

This request covers all time periods for which each active officer has been certified; no date range limitation is needed because I am interested in the full certification history of anyone who is currently active as a law enforcement officer. If any portion of these records is withheld as exempt, I request that you segregate any exempt material and release the rest. If possible, please provide the records in an electronic spreadsheet or database format (e.g. Excel or CSV).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FDC Miami incident reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any incident reports, restraint forms, and Use of Force After-Action Reports generated by incidents occurring on April 15, 2025, at FDC Miami.
- Any video surveillance footage of an April 15, 2025, disturbance at FDC Miami, which was reported in local media and confirmed by BOP: https://www.local10.com/news/local/2025/04/16/disruptive-detainees-treated-for-minor-injuries-in-miami-federal-jail-incident-authorities-say/

Please note that the required by law under 5 U.S.C. § 552(b) to produce any “reasonably segregable” portion of records being withheld. The duty to segregate ensures that agencies are not allowed to issue “sweeping, generalized claims of exemption for documents." Mead Data Cent., Inc., v. U.S. Dep’t of Air Force, 566 F.2d 242, 260 (D.C. Cir. 1977)

Regarding the surveillance footage, please note the D.C. Circuit Court of Appeals opinion in Michael S. Evans v. Federal Bureau of Prisons. USCA Case #18-5068 (D.C. Cir. 2020). In that case, the circuit court held that the video surveillance footage is subject to the same segregability standards as other FOIA records. ("It is not at all clear why the government could not at least isolate some screenshots that would meet the same sort of segregability standards typically applied to printed material." Id.)

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

CJ Ciaramella

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records included in the application, selection, and hiring of Ms Sherry Wallace as the Director of Communications for the Virginia Military Institute from the date the job was advertised through the selection process to the date of this request, including, without limitation, verification of her military service and other qualifications. Understand that the names of some applicants who were not selected may be confidential and reasonably redacted from such documents as scoring sheets, etc. This should not apply to the application Ms Wallace submitted or her qualifications, verifications VMI did, etc., as she was hired for the position and is now a public figure, a state employee, and VMI - as well as Ms Wallace - made several social media posts, public announcements and information on their websites in the Press about her background and qualifications. All of her information should be disclosed and readily available from VMI.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Michael Ledeen (August 1, 1941 - May 18, 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into historian Michael Ledeen (August 1, 1941 - May 18, 2025). His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his NY Sun obituary at the following link: https://www.nysun.com/article/scholar-and-journalist-michael-ledeen-dies-at-83-after-a-long-career-struggling-for-american-ideals-at-home-and-abroad

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

title: Naples Pride v. City of Naples, et al.

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Naples Pride v. City of Naples, et al.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any document(s) sufficient to show the amount(s) budgeted for attorneys' fees and costs in connection with Naples Pride v. City of Naples, et al., No. 2:25-cv-00291 (M.D. Fla. Apr. 10, 2025), including any appeal.

2. All invoices from Roper, Townsend & Sutphen, P.A. in connection with Naples Pride or Naples Pride v. City of Naples, et al., No. 2:25-cv-00291 (M.D. Fla. Apr. 10, 2025), including any appeal.

3. All invoices from Dickman Law Firm in connection with Naples Pride or Naples Pride v. City of Naples, et al., No. 2:25-cv-00291 (M.D. Fla. Apr. 10, 2025), including any appeal.

3. Any non-privileged emails sent by (a) any member of the City Council, (b) the Mayor, or (c) the Vice-Mayor on or after May 1, 2025, which mention any of these terms: "pride", "drag", "ACLU", "liberty".

4. Any non-privileged text messages or other communications (excluding emails) sent or received by (a) any member of the City Council, (b) the Mayor, or (c) the Vice-Mayor on or after May 1, 2025, which mention any of these terms: "pride", "drag", "ACLU", "liberty".

"Communications" means and includes text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Diversity Statistics for Productions Receiving IL Film Tax Credit (2021–Present)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Related to the Illinois Film Production Services Tax Credit program:

All diversity statistics and related forms submitted by productions that were approved for and received the Illinois Film Production Services Tax Credit from January 1, 2021, through the date of this request.

Specifically, I am seeking:

The diversity report(s) or workforce demographic summary tracking sheets submitted by each approved production, which include data on race/ethnicity, gender, and job categories of employees or contractors hired.

Any standardized forms or summaries required under Section M (or equivalent) of the film tax credit application.

The name of the production, name of the production company, and year of submission associated with each record.

If these records are compiled in a spreadsheet, database export, or summary report, I would prefer to receive those formats (e.g., Excel, CSV, or PDF), but I am also happy to receive individual documents or scanned forms where necessary.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

communications.subject: Your Lane County, OR public records request #25-295 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
Lane County, OR ************************************************************************ Your record request #25-295 has been submitted successfully. Lane County is in receipt of your public records request. We will provide you with additional information as soon as practicable and without unreasonable delay. Oregon public records law and the Lane Manual require the County to provide the public a right to inspect any record that is not otherwise protected, or to obtain copies of public documents not otherwise protected. The County is not obligated to create documents that do not exist, to provide documents that it is not the custodian of record for, to change the format the documents are saved in, to provide the documents in a more expensive format or format that the County doesn’t have the ability to provide the documents in, or to explain the documents.     It is the County’s policy to collect full cost for any documents provided, as allowed by statute and subject to public interest waiver provisions under Oregon law. This will include staff time researching whether or not the County is in possession of the related documents, and any other actual costs of making public records available, including costs for summarizing, compiling or tailoring the public records to meet the request, and any necessary redaction and review of the public records by staff. The County will inform you of the estimated cost and will wait to receive confirmation from you (and/or payment) prior to incurring any costs associated with complying with this public records request.  The due date for your request may be later than usual because the office is closed on: * May 26: Memorial Day As the requester, you can always see the status of your request by signing into the Lane County, OR portal. If you haven't already signed in, you may need to activate or setup your account to get started. Once your account is activated, you can communicate directly with the Lane County, OR through NextRequest. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Lane County, OR.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: [External Message Added] Lane County, OR public records request #25-295
communications.communication:
Lane County, OR ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #25-295: Lane County is uncertain whether it is in possession of the records you have requested. Your request is vague or overly broad. This office requests clarification of your request in an effort to assist us in our search for records and expedite a response to your request. Please identify as specifically as possible that which you are requesting. Lane County does not have any responsibility for operations at the Lorane Post Office. It is possible that some Lane County employee email messages could contain references to the Lorane Post Office but those are likely to be incidental comments and not related to any County business. If you are requesting such emails, we will provide you with a fee estimate for searching for those emails. Please let us know if you would like us to provide that fee estimate. Failing to respond to this request within 60 days will result in closure of your request. ORS 192.329(4)(b). ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Lane County, OR.
